page.title: 08Diet in Tockwith
page.content: Our survey was to find out what {vegetables}people eat and whether they are home-grown. 100% of our survey have a garden. 65% have a vegetable patch. The main reasons why the others do not are: 1. Their gardens are too small. 2. Insufficient interest and time. 3. Good vegetables are readily available locally. Those who do grow their own vegetables do so for the following reasons. 1. They are fresh and taste better. 2. They have better food value. 3. Gardening is a hobby. 4. To save money. 5. They dislike the widespread use of chemicals by commercial growers. 6. Surplus produce can be frozen. Vegetables grown include beans, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes and peas.
